Reviews.Content: Spacious, modern, impractical. The appartment was roomy and the sofa comfortable. The receptionists were pleasant and helpful , the pool looked nice and the whole place appeared clean. The flat screen TV appealed but of 40 channels, only BBC news and CNN were in English. The kitchenette had no kettle, draining area or tea towel, cups were tiny, the fridgefreezer was a larder fridge. The bed was uncomfortable and the safe, listed as a room facility, was located in reception and cost 4 Euros per day! When one of the hotplates was switched on, we lost all power. When we reported a faulty light, it was made usable at the expense of the other! The Air Con. was converted to heating midweek, without forewarning and we unwittingly heated the appartment to an unbearable temp. despite the controls indicating othrwise.
Reviews.Author: mugglefan

Reviews.Content: Great Place The Atenea Apartments are clean, spacious and good value. The breakfast is more than enough for the largest appetite. It's in a great location just a short stroll down to the beach and the very nice restaurants a bit further on. We stayed there for 4 nights in June and had a wonderful time. But avoid the national holiday for St John unless you enjoy an all night party atmosphere.Vilanova is a nice little place with good transport links to Bacelona. But it鈥檚 not full of English bars and cafes doing an all day breakfast !
Reviews.Author: hillbilly_8

Reviews.Content: Super, relaxed holiday This isn't a 'five star' property by any means, but as a holiday destination it truly excels which is why I'm awarding it 5 stars. The studios themselves are extremely clean, have quiet air conditioning, and are well equipped for basic self catering (though not fully equipped for cooking meals), have plenty of storage room and are very safe feeling. All the staff at the Atenea are multi lingual and very welcoming and friendly - you can't take this for granted in Spain as we have found elsewhere to our cost. There are two PC terminals set up in the lobby and internet use is free. The rooms are relatively basic but the shining star is the beautiful pool area - I spent full days here just relaxing, sunbathing and enjoying the lovely atmosphere. There is loads of room for everybody to get a sun lounger, and the gardens are kept absolutely immaculate by the hard working staff. Vilanova itself is a wonderful little resort, mainly visited by the Spanish themselves. It's ideal forfamilies with kids and for couples but probably not a good choice for single sex groups looking to party. We discovered a wonderful 'Ramblas', much nicer than Barcelona's, and with loads of great shops and cafes. Vilanova is generally cheaper then resorts such as Sitges, and has a more laid back vibe in my opinion. There was quite a lot of building going on when we visited, and it will be interesting to see how Vilanova looks in years to come. We felt we had discovered a 'hidden gem'!We have visited the Atenea Park twice now and will probably go back again. It's only a few steps from the beach yet on a quiet street, and is really in the perfect location for exploring the coast and Barcelona, as it's a very easy and cheap train journey to all destinations. I'd recommend it to anybody. Only drawback for us was the rooms have single beds which took a bit of getting used to, but hardly a deal breaker.
Reviews.Author: oatybix

Reviews.Content: well much to our annoyance the pool was closed untill 1st may for the spannish holiday then it opened as we were going home .breakfast never changed the whole week hotel is nice and clean rooms bar in hotel only open from 8 till10 at night vilanova is what i would say is a quiet place nice beach would not rush back but would not tell anybody not to go nice chinese called palacio ocean on sea front and good shops on the ramblas in the middle of the town .did enjoy ourselfs but the whole place could have had more life to it
Reviews.Author: ocheye

Reviews.Content: Clean and Spacious We have just returned from a long weekend at the Atenea Park Apartments in Vilanova I La Geltru. The hotel is ideally placed if you want to visit Barcelona but do not want to stay in the city. The beach is less than 5 minutes walk and the hotel has a pool (which unfortunately for us did not open until June). Nevertheless, it is just overa half hour drive to Barcelona or a 50 minute train ride. The station is only 15 minutes walk from the hotel and the train is clean and inexpensive.The hotel rooms are spacious, with separate lounge and bedroom, and clean. The only item that was missing was a kettle and cups for tea or coffee making. Breakfast was ample but monotonous - no change in options over the three mornings that we stayed.On average we would definitely recommend this hotel to other travellers - but bring a kettle!
Reviews.Author: AberdeenGlenn

Reviews.Content: clean and comfy       the beach at sunset
Reviews.Author: shoebedo

Reviews.Content: Good value / Good position The hotel is very good. Not only the apartments...it is possible also to book some rooms (or some apartments as rooms) at very reasonable prices.Breakfast is good and probably this is the most modern hotel in Vilanova.In 2 minutes it's possible to be on the beach by foot and the restaurants are 5minutes walking.The best choice in Vilanova
Reviews.Author: barzies

Reviews.Content: Fantastic I am back about a month now from the atenea park hotel suites. I have to say that this hotel was fantastic. The staff were very friendly the rooms were spotless and it is very close to the beach. The breakfast range is one of the main parts of the hotel. It is delicious.The pool is quite and there is a club twice a day for kids. I would recomend this hotel to everyone from young couples to older couples to singles and to married couples.This hotel is fantastic and i highly recomend it to anyone.
Reviews.Author: Tiger657

Reviews.Content: Reasonable Just arrived back from a weeks stay in the Atenea apartments. It was okay, but there were a number of things I diskliked about them, as others have pointed out below, if you are serious about self catering, this is certainly not the place for you - there is a two ring electric hob and thats it. We bought mugs of our own so that we could have a decent size cup of tea - made using our travel kettle. There were hardly any utensils at all, not even a spoon to stir anything with - other than a general eating spoon. The room we were allocated was at the back of the apartments and there was a road running past, which meant we heard mopeds whizzing past fairly frequently throughout the night, also it seems to be on a flight path and whilst you couldn't hear aeroplanes much after 11pm, they could be heard until that time.On the plus side it had an excellent air conditioning system, was kept very clean and had a nice area to sit in of an evening.All in all fairly decent accommodation, but it wouldn't be my first choice - even on a budget.
Reviews.Author: Travelmonster01

Reviews.Content: Great value Got a late booking. Price was very good. Exceptionally clean and quiet. We had 2 adults and 2 children in room bit of a squeeze but perfectly adequate for the time we spent there. Could do with either a microwave or small oven but apart from that no complaints. Pool lovely and clean with a lifeguard.
Reviews.Author: Peterboroughtraveler

Reviews.Content: Hmmm, where to start? Well, where shall I start?The apartholtel as it was advertised is clean - one of the cleanest (if not the best) that I have stayed in to date. The cleaners are brutal!. The location is spot-on in terms of restuarants and the beautiful beach. However, the entertainment is non-existent. This is a major downside if you have children. Also, don't expect too much from the on-site restuarant itself. Albeit, they do good food, you would be much better off walking down the road and placing yourself in one of the many nice fish restuarants.There is no pool-side bar for drinks/snacks other than the restaurant which is not stocked very well. There's a hut at the back which advertises entertainment for the kids but I nevr saw it open once in the 11 days that I was there.Staff are very friendly but I had asked for some bigger cups for some tea (espresso cups for a tea bag is impossible!). I asked 3 times over 3 days and none were coming other than if we have them they'll be in your room by now. It took me to sweet-talk the restuarant manager to hand over 2 bigger cups to get them. They also state that the rooms are well equipped........... well, apart from a 2-ring electric hob and a fridge, do NOT expect anything else. No oven, no kettle no toaster etc etc.In addtion to this, I had booked a room for 3 people. Be careful here as my 2-year old had to sleep on the sofa for 10 nights. Which I think was the better option as the beds are a bit on the hard side.All said and done, although basic is was what I consider fairly good value in terms of cleanliness and location.A visit to Sitges is a must as is Tarragona. Be prepared to get lost in Barcelone City Centre (especially if you have a car). If driving, buy a VERY GOOD map as the roadsigns in Spain are.....hmmmmmmmmmmm, fairly non-existent and when they are there, somewhat confusing - especially in the city centre.Beautiful country, people are friendly, the area has not been damaged by overseas tourists so far (thank god) so, be prepared to take your Spanish terms book everywhere with youas English is not wide-spread at all.
Reviews.Author: MADNBAD

Reviews.Content: Great Views, Great Place The apartments were just what we were looking for. Great location, views of the sea, friendly staff, breakfast a must - it sets you up for the day. They are located in the Hotel Distict of Vilanova, right beside the seafront. Plenty of on street parking (we left our hire car parked outside for the week and it was untouched). Access to main motorways only 5 minutes drive. Supermarkets also nearby.
Reviews.Author: Reiltin

Reviews.Content: Excellent value for money. Very Children Friendly. The pools are lovely. The apartment is very nice and very clean, staff are friendly and keen to do anything for you. The hotel restaurant is extraordinarily good! During April la Geltru closes down a little, so you are limited for places to eat, but during the holidays the town is a lovely, lively place to be. The beach also has the softest sand. Its very clean and the rock pools near the 'bull' are full of little fish for the children to try and catch! We hired a car, but the best way to get into Barcelona from Le Geltru is by train, they leave every 20mins or so and only cost 4euro. You also get the added benifit of the view! Barcelona is tough going with kids, although G眉ell park makes the trip worth while. PortAventura is a better bet and only 30mins down the road! Its expensive (about 100 euros for a family for the day) but worth every penny!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Quality all round Great facility, with everything that you could need.Apartment was spacious, with good facilities, including extensive range of TV channels.Staff were very friendly, and English was wide spead, if not universal.Location of the apartments is fine, in a quieter end of town, but still only 10 minutes walk from a great range of local restaurants. The hotel restaurant is also excellent quality and value.Breakfast was superb, buffet style, that filled you up for the rest of the day.Wouldn't hesitate to go back, although I suspect that at the height of the summer season it could be quite noisy.Go for it.
Reviews.Author: Bobo148

Reviews.Content: A great value       A statue on the beach next to the hotel
Reviews.Author: treechaser

Reviews.Content: Good deal this is a nice clean small apartment. Location is in a nice cute town near barcelona. we brought 2 teenagers so we were in tight quarters but were not in the room much. It cut on costs not staying in Barcelona but keep in mind, if you rent a car (which you will need to if you want to make things easy),,, it is almost 5 euros for the toll to and from barcelona. another thing the city is cute and you are right by the beach and there are a bunch of restaurants,,, but the food was not very good at any of the restaurants we tried. Because we stayed there we ended up going further on the highway to Taragona which was a really nice sea town with ruins.. We saw a lot of the area, not just Barcelona, which made the hotel work out for us. If you just want to go to Barcelona, it is not a good idea to stay that far away.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Fantastic We just got back from Barcelona this morning. We stayed at the Atenea Park Suites. The hotel is just like it is in the photos, all the staff at the hotel are very friendly and helpful.The Rooms are spacious and very clean, the maids came everyday whilst we were there to clean our room. The beach is just at the end of the road and there is so many places to eat in the area that you will be spoilt for choice.We got a taxi from the airport which cost us 58 euros. It would have been alot easier to get a tube from the airport to Barcelona Sant and then took a train to Vilanova.Unfortunately there are no clubs or bars nearby, we didn't find this a problem, if that it what you are into this area may not be for you, but as the train station is only a 15 minutes walk away you can go into Barcelona to clubs. Make sure you go on the tour or Barcelona. You paid 17 euro and you can get to visit all the sites. You get off the bus and can board the next one that comes along. You can visit the olympic statium, football stadium, cathedrals, world trade centre, etc.We had a very relaxing holiday. Back to work and the real world now.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Wow what a suprise Vilanova I La Geltru, 40 mins from barcelona, 6 mins from Sitges(by frequent train) is a real find. this aparthotel is also.3 of us spent 7 nights here Aug 04, wanting to book and return immediately. It is modern, spotless, effecient and welcoming, tho some of the catering staff need to cheer up. We were booked in, shown to our rooms and in the large heated pool within minutes.The buffet breakfast and other meals were of a high standard, varied content and plentiful.Joy of joys its quiet, with most of the guests booking individually rather than package deals, who appeared to be from Spain, then English/Irish. The beautiful quiet beach is across the road, with all the conveniences one would expect was a dream. all in all I whole heartedly recommend all and sundry to avail of this accomodation, being so close to Sitges and Barcelona, but this town also has its charm if explored.
Reviews.Author: auntiejoan
